description: Add pins, follow and display options to your app.

blocks.name: getAccessToken
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to get back a access token.

args.name: clientId
args.info: The Client ID obtained from Pinterest.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: The Client Secret obtained from Pinterest.

args.name: code
args.info: The access code you received from your redirect URI.

blocks.name: getUser
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to fetch user data.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

blocks.name: getBoards
blocks.description: This endpoint returns a list of the authenticated user’s public boards, including the URL, ID and name.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

blocks.name: getBoardsSuggestions
blocks.description: This endpoint returns the boards that Pinterest would suggest to the authenticated user if they were to save the specified Pin. The default response returns the ID, URL and name of the boards.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: pinId
args.info: The pin_id that you want to return board suggestions for.

blocks.name: getUserLikedPins
blocks.description: This endpoint returns the ID, link, URL and description of the Pins the authenticated user has liked.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: cursor
args.info: Pass the cursor value in your next request to receive the next 25 items in the list.

blocks.name: getUserPins
blocks.description: This endpoint returns the ID, link, URL and descriptions of the authenticated user’s Pins.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: cursor
args.info: Pass the cursor value in your next request to receive the next 25 items in the list.

blocks.name: searchBoardNames
blocks.description: Searches the authenticated user’s board names (but not Pins on boards). An empty response indicates that nothing was found that matched your search terms. The default response returns the ID, name and URL of boards matching your query.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: query
args.info: What you want to search for.

args.name: cursor
args.info: Pass the cursor value in your next request to receive the next 25 items in the list.

blocks.name: searchPinDescriptions
blocks.description: Searches the authenticated user’s Pin descriptions. An empty response indicates that nothing was found that matched your search terms. The default response returns the ID, link, URL and description of Pins matching your query.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: query
args.info: What you want to search for.

args.name: cursor
args.info: Pass the cursor value in your next request to receive the next 25 items in the list.

blocks.name: getFollowers
blocks.description: Returns the users who follow the authenticated user. The default response returns the first and last name, ID and URL of the users.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: cursor
args.info: Pass the cursor value in your next request to receive the next 25 items in the list.

blocks.name: getFollowedBoards
blocks.description: Returns the boards that the authenticated user follows. The default response returns the ID, name and URL of the board.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: cursor
args.info: Pass the cursor value in your next request to receive the next 25 items in the list.

blocks.name: getFollowedTopics
blocks.description: Returns the topics (e.g, modern architecture, Sherlock) that the authenticated user follows. The default response returns the ID and name of the topic.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: cursor
args.info: Pass the cursor value in your next request to receive the next 25 items in the list.

blocks.name: getFollowings
blocks.description: Returns the users that the authenticated user follows. The default response returns the first and last name, ID and URL of the users.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: cursor
args.info: Pass the cursor value in your next request to receive the next 25 items in the list.

blocks.name: followBoard
blocks.description: Makes the authenticated user follow the specified board.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: board
args.info: The board you want to follow in the format <username>/<board_name>. For example: designboom/technology

blocks.name: followUser
blocks.description: Makes the authenticated user follow the specified user.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: user
args.info: The username of the user that you want to follow. For example: designboom

blocks.name: unfollowBoard
blocks.description: Makes the authenticated user unfollow the specified board.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: board
args.info: The board you want to unfollow in the format <username>/<board_name>. For example: designboom/technology

blocks.name: unfollowUser
blocks.description: Makes the authenticated user unfollow the specified user.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: user
args.info: The username or user ID of the user you want to unfollow. For example: designboom

blocks.name: createBoard
blocks.description: Creates a board for the authenticated user. The default response returns the ID, URL and name of the created board.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: name
args.info: The name of the new board.

args.name: description
args.info: The new board’s description.

blocks.name: getSingleBoard
blocks.description: The default response returns the ID, URL and name of the specified board.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: board
args.info: The board you want to fetch in the format <username>/<board_name>. For example: designboom/technology

blocks.name: updateSingleBoard
blocks.description: Changes the chosen board’s name and/or description. The default response returns the ID, URL and name of the edited board.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: board
args.info: The board you want to edit in the format <username>/<board_name>. For example: designboom/technology

args.name: name
args.info: The new board name.

args.name: description
args.info: The new board description.

blocks.name: deleteBoard
blocks.description: Deletes the specified board. This action is permanent and cannot be undone.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: board
args.info: The board you want to delete in the format <username>/<board_name>. For example: designboom/technology

blocks.name: createSinglePin
blocks.description: Creates a Pin for the authenticated user. The default response returns the note, URL, link and ID of the created Pin.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: board
args.info: The board you want the new Pin to be on. In the format <username>/<board_name>. For example: designboom/technology

args.name: note
args.info: The Pin’s description.

args.name: image
args.info: Upload the image you want to pin

args.name: link
args.info: The URL the Pin will link to when you click through.

blocks.name: updateSinglePin
blocks.description: Changes the board, description and/or link of the Pin.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: pin
args.info: The ID (unique string of numbers and letters) of the Pin you want to edit.

args.name: board
args.info: The board you want to move the Pin to, in the format <username>/<board_name>. For example: designboom/technology

args.name: note
args.info: The new Pin description.

args.name: link
args.info: The new Pin link.

blocks.name: getSinglePin
blocks.description: The default response returns the ID, link, URL and description of the Pin.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: pin
args.info: The ID (unique string of numbers and letters) of the Pin you want information about.

blocks.name: deleteSinglePin
blocks.description: Deletes the specified Pin. This action is permanent and cannot be undone.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: pin
args.info: The ID (unique string of numbers and letters) of the Pin you want to delete.

blocks.name: getBoardPins
blocks.description: The default response returns a list of Pins on the board with their ID, URL, link and description.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: board
args.info: The board you want to fetch in the format <username>/<board_name>. For example: designboom/technology

args.name: cursor
args.info: Pass the cursor value in your next request to receive the next 25 items in the list.
